In a recommendation for discipline memorandum, Christopher Strickland, who was Lawing's supervisor at the time, stated the following.  In light of the behavior of Sergeant Lawing being below conduct standard, below moral standard, below ethical standard, and below supervisory standard, I must dismiss anything but objective reasoning and state the following.  Sergeant J.F.  Lawing, by his intentional conduct, has shrunk from his duties as a supervisor and he has committed a wrong that cannot be ignored or minimized, for he has violated the trust of his office, his subordinates, and his supervisor.
